title: Lesson 55
paragraph: Feelings and emotional reactions — useful words to describe moods and responses.

words.meaning: feeling happy or satisfied about something
words.example: She was pleased with her exam results.

words.meaning: feeling deep pleasure or satisfaction from achievements
words.example: His parents were proud of his success.

words.meaning: free from tension and anxiety; calm
words.japaneseMeaning: リラックスした／落ち着いた
words.example: She felt relaxed after the massage.
He was sad to say goodbye to his friends.

words.meaning: contented because expectations have been met
words.example: I am satisfied with the final design.

words.meaning: feeling frightened or worried about danger
words.japaneseMeaning: 怖がっている／おびえている
words.example: The loud noise made the child scared.

words.meaning: surprised and upset by an unexpected event
words.japaneseMeaning: ショックを受けた／びっくりした
words.example: We were shocked by the sudden news.

words.japaneseMeaning: ストレスを感じている
words.example: He felt stressed before the deadline.

words.meaning: feeling or showing shock because something was unexpected
words.example: She was surprised by the party her friends planned.

words.meaning: in need of sleep or rest; weary
words.example: After the hike, everyone was tired.

words.meaning: not happy; feeling sorrow or dissatisfaction
words.example: She was unhappy with the service.
He was upset when he missed the train.
